intro: Diodia microcarpa, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has a branched stem and alternate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Diodia microcarpa is often found in moist, open areas such as roadsides and disturbed soils.
